meanings.definition: To laugh in a covert or partly suppressed manner.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help snickering during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: The children were snickering in the back of the classroom.
meanings.sent3: His snickering at the movie made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered through the trees, snickering softly.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous squirrel was caught snickering at the bird feeder.

meanings.sent1: The eerie snickering echoed in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent2: I heard a snickering coming from behind the door.
meanings.sent3: The snickering of the old clock added a spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The snickering of the stream was calming to listen to.
meanings.sent5: The distant snickering of the hyenas sent shivers down my spine.
